nodes.bodyText: are you annotating the method or its return type here? imo should be the return type

This refers to the return type of the method, the Boolean.
Obviously pending on loom 0.5 for jetbrains annotations to make this concretely clear.

Aren't those two annotation styles effectively the same?
Pretty sure there is probably a way to make checkstyle enforce the annotation position in that case.
for the compiler, yes -- but for the reader imo that's more clear. Of course this is entirely a code style thing, but hopefully i have permission to bikeshed a little
If you did want that change, you may as well open an RFC for style change (I want religious use of this in codebase so I'll need to open one soon).

Not totally necessary, but this could probably just be expressed with the ternary operator instead.
return bool == null ? DEFAULT : TriState.of(bool.booleanValue());

Same here, could probably be a ternary. I only mention it because all of the methods in the file are basically the same level of complexity, but some of them use the ternary operator, and some of them just use a traditional if statement. It might be good to just pick one and uniformly use that one.
return this == TriState.DEFAULT ? null : this.get();
Sometimes you use TriState.FALSE and other times you just use FALSE. I personally prefer TriState.FALSE just to be explicit, but I would just choose one and stick to that as a general style rule.
Choose TRUE or TriState.TRUE as a general style
Choose TRUE and FALSE or TriState.TRUE and TriState.FALSE as a general style
Choose DEFAULT or TriState.DEFAULT as a general style
Choose TRUE or TriState.TRUE as a general style
Choose DEFAULT or TriState.DEFAULT as a general style
Choose TRUE or TriState.TRUE as a general style
everything else checks this == DEFAULT instead, should probably be changed here, too, for consistency.
